SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To report a patient with Behcet disease presenting with acute optic neuropathy
METHODS: A 47-year-old man was admitted to the authors' clinic owing to sudden visual loss in the left eye
Ophthalmologic and systemic examinations were performed
RESULTS: Visual acuity was 4/10 in the left eye
Fundus examination demonstrated swollen optic disc with blurred margins
There was relative afferent pupil defect in the same eye
Mega-dose corticosteroid treatment was started with the diagnosis of acute optic neuropathy
CONCLUSIONS: BehÃ§et disease rarely presents with acute optic neuropathy
